review_blob: 500ml bottle bought at systembolaget in Kungsbacka 15 november 2013. Amber slightly body with huge diminishing lively head. Aroma: raisins, rum, saffron buns (Lussebullar), coriander and hint of tangerines. Gives me the warm cosy Christmas feeling. Taste: bun dough, sage, marmalade, cardamom and orange peel. Makes me longing for X-mas, warm and nice. It just gets better and better! Jingelbells, jingelbells!!

Wonderful Amarillo aroma, really pleasant. Light copper colour, off-white head. Malty, herbal, hint of citrus, bitter not so pleasant. As a home brewer i think i recognize the use of dry yeast, Fermentis. The test we have done gives a really bitter, long lasting, unpleasant taste. The older the beer get the more unpleasant. I am sad to say that i taste this in most of the swedish craft brews of today. Sad! Why cant you use fresh and healthy yeast??  Amarillo is a low co-humulone variety and should not be bitter. Fresh yeast pls.

Appearance: Head short and lively. Light orange in color. Liquid hazy.
Aroma: Bubbelgum, fresh and short.
Taste: light sweetness and short
Body is light, texture thin-oily, carbonation is average. Long finish with a low bitterness.
Overall a nice first commercial try. I do miss some complexity from special malts. Used white sugar? Some sourness from something. Ok

Aroma is full of fruitiness, whatever that means. Bubblegum with citrus notes. I can scent some butterscotch, diacetyl?? Hopefully not meaning this ale is on its way to go bad. Its pleasant though. A rest product from fermenting??
Color is hazy and coppery. Taste is a balanced whit a long a fresh bitterness that lingers on and on, for a long time.
A lovely IPA, that tastes homebrewed, in the best positive way. With passion and for your best friends.
Recommended

Aroma:Caramelish and some nuts? Colour is brownish, faded haxelnuts. Liquid: hazy and head tanish.
Taste; would like to say balanced between bitter and maltiness with some salty notes. Body is full with a slick texture. Long finish witgh a balanced taste.
This is Brittain on a bottle, nice!
